name: White-winged Duck
description: The White-winged Duck is a large duck with dark plumage, known for its secretive nature.
spread_note: Found in Southeast Asia, including India and Thailand.
food_note: Forages in dense wetlands, often at night.
proportions: Length: 65-80 cm, wingspan: 1.1-1.3 m, weight: 2-4 kg.
reproduction: Lays 6-13 eggs in a tree cavity, incubation about 33 days.
attractions: Rare in zoos due to their elusive habits, but notable for their size.
projects_note: Endangered due to habitat loss; conservation programs are active.
breeding: Bred in captivity to support population recovery.
